topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5415ead66368726925890000#post_5415ead66368726925890000
[bq="gasmaskangel"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5415e9a563687255260d0100#post_5415e9a563687255260d0100
I have my doubts about Kantai Collection really overtaking Touhou in terms of popularity, admittedly from a perspective of profound ignorance regarding both properties.

My reasoning is simply that Touhou has more diverse cast of interesting characters while Kantai seems to pretty much consist of generically hot anime girls with guns stapled on.[/bq]
Yeah; I honestly don't see Kantai lasting as long as Touhou.  Touhou has been around for fifteen years; Kantai on the other hand has been around for *one* year.

topics.body: I decided to take a look at what finnish media is saying about the whole quinnspiracy debacle. What _very_ little there was, was worth a giggle.
topics.author: 5007bbdf7f123b112f00023a

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541603f063687246e6500000#post_541603f063687246e6500000
One finnish gaming site talked about it from a neutral point of view, just telling the facts but not taking a side. The comments were divided between people talking about it and people saying 'We don't give a fuck, give us game news'.

There were also whopping two blog posts about it; one by a feminist condemning harassment and claiming it's a bad time for women in the gaming industry, and a response to that written by a female software developer who said that it's actually a pretty good time for women in the industry, and that we really shouldn't put hacks like quinn on a pedestal because that degrades the achievements of women who actually work in the industry and make decent stuff.
